fields.description:
{panel:title=Assessment|borderStyle=dashed|borderColor=#000000|titleBGColor=#CCCC99|bgColor=#CCCCCC}
Attempted to use [ec2-upload-bundle|http://docs.aws.amazon.com/AWSEC2/latest/CommandLineReference/CLTRG-ami-upload-bundle.html] from within an instance running on Eucalyptus 3.4.0 cloud.  The following error was displayed:
{code}
$ ec2-upload-bundle -b bundle-vol-docker -m /mnt/image/raring-docker.manifest.xml -a AKIYO5GIWPS4VIRN7ZU2 -s NAjydxBQuiN5sHUZpzKFHImv1W3k2O32BiZ14bXJ --url http://walrus.euca-hasp.eucalyptus-systems.com:8773/services/Walrus/
ERROR: Error talking to S3: Curl.Error(6): Couldn't resolve host 'bundle-vol-docker.walrus.euca-hasp.eucalyptus-systems.com'.
{code}
{panel}
{panel:title=Signs|borderStyle=dashed|borderColor=#000000|titleBGColor=#CCCC99|bgColor=#CCCCCC}
Instance could resolve Walrus just fine:
{code}
$ nslookup walrus.euca-hasp.eucalyptus-systems.com
Server:		10.104.1.216
Address:	10.104.1.216#53

Name:	walrus.euca-hasp.eucalyptus-systems.com
Address: 10.104.1.216
{code}
Executed the command with _--debug_ option:
{code}
$ ec2-upload-bundle -b bundle-vol-docker -m /mnt/image/raring-docker.manifest.xml -a AKIYO5GIWPS4VIRN7ZU2 -s NAjydxBQuiN5sHUZpzKFHImv1W3k2O32BiZ14bXJ --url http://walrus.euca-hasp.eucalyptus-systems.com:8773/services/Walrus/ --debug
curl -sSL -H "date:Sun, 17 Nov 2013 22:34:53 GMT" -H "Authorization:AWS AKIYO5GIWPS4VIRN7ZU2:5sG7bHf82xG3vTusjZg1hQj3kk4=" -o /tmp/ec2-get-response20131117-23360-6uouy3 'http://bundle-vol-docker.walrus.euca-hasp.eucalyptus-systems.com:8773/services/Walrus/?location' -w "Response-Code: %{http_code}\nContent-Type: %{content_type}"
----COMMAND------------------
-H "date:Sun, 17 Nov 2013 22:34:53 GMT" -H "Authorization:AWS AKIYO5GIWPS4VIRN7ZU2:5sG7bHf82xG3vTusjZg1hQj3kk4=" -o /tmp/ec2-get-response20131117-23360-6uouy3 'http://bundle-vol-docker.walrus.euca-hasp.eucalyptus-systems.com:8773/services/Walrus/?location'
----EXIT-CODE----------------
6
----STDOUT-------------------
Response-Code: 000
Content-Type:
----STDERR-------------------
curl: (6) Couldn't resolve host 'bundle-vol-docker.walrus.euca-hasp.eucalyptus-systems.com'
-----------------------------
/usr/lib/ec2-ami-tools/lib/ec2/common/http.rb:346:in `rescue in get'
/usr/lib/ec2-ami-tools/lib/ec2/common/http.rb:353:in `get'
/usr/lib/ec2-ami-tools/lib/ec2/common/s3support.rb:111:in `get_bucket_location'
/usr/lib/ec2-ami-tools/lib/ec2/amitools/uploadbundle.rb:113:in `get_bucket_location'
/usr/lib/ec2-ami-tools/lib/ec2/amitools/uploadbundle.rb:282:in `upload_bundle'
/usr/lib/ec2-ami-tools/lib/ec2/amitools/uploadbundle.rb:337:in `main'
/usr/lib/ec2-ami-tools/lib/ec2/amitools/tool_base.rb:201:in `run'
/usr/lib/ec2-ami-tools/lib/ec2/amitools/uploadbundle.rb:356:in `<main>'
ERROR: Error talking to S3: Curl.Error(6): Couldn't resolve host 'bundle-vol-docker.walrus.euca-hasp.eucalyptus-systems.com'
Curl.Output: Response-Code: 000
Curl.Output: Content-Type:.
/usr/lib/ec2-ami-tools/lib/ec2/amitools/uploadbundle.rb:320:in `rescue in upload_bundle'
/usr/lib/ec2-ami-tools/lib/ec2/amitools/uploadbundle.rb:274:in `upload_bundle'
/usr/lib/ec2-ami-tools/lib/ec2/amitools/uploadbundle.rb:337:in `main'
/usr/lib/ec2-ami-tools/lib/ec2/amitools/tool_base.rb:201:in `run'
/usr/lib/ec2-ami-tools/lib/ec2/amitools/uploadbundle.rb:356:in `<main>'
{code}
{panel}
{panel:title=Pertinent Data|borderStyle=dashed|borderColor=#000000|titleBGColor=#CCCC99|bgColor=#CCCCCC}
* This affects our Amazon EC2 AMI compatibility story.  If certain EC2 AMI tool commands don't work with Eucalyptus, we should document those issues.  
* If users want to use euca2ools on any other distribution outside of CentOS, users will have to install euca2ools manually.  We need point users to documentation that show how to build euca2ools for non-CentOS/RHEL/Fedora images.   For example, to install on Ubuntu Raring (13.04):
{code}
# sudo apt-get install python-lxml python-libxslt1 git python-setuptools
# git clone https://github.com/eucalyptus/euca2ools.git
# cd euca2ools
# sudo python setup.py install
{code}
{panel}
{panel:title=Workaround|borderStyle=dashed|borderColor=#000000|titleBGColor=#CCCC99|bgColor=#CCCCCC}
Use euca2ools
{panel}
fields.summary: ec2-upload-bundle doesn't work due to resolution failure
fields.environment:
*non-HA*
** 1 x CLC, Walrus
** 1 x CC, SC
** 1 x NC

comments.body:
Uploaded sosreport from CLC/Walrus machine.

{code}

{code}

DNS properties for Eucalyptus:
{code}
# cat odc-d-06-07-2013111719271384745276/sos_commands/eucafrontend/euca-describe-properties | grep dns
PROPERTY	bootstrap.webservices.use_dns_delegation	true
PROPERTY	bootstrap.webservices.use_instance_dns	true
PROPERTY	dns.enabled	true
PROPERTY	dns.instancedata.enabled	true
PROPERTY	dns.ns.enabled	true
PROPERTY	dns.recursive.enabled	true
PROPERTY	dns.services.enabled	true
PROPERTY	dns.split_horizon.enabled	true
PROPERTY	dns.spoof_regions.enabled	true
PROPERTY	dns.spoof_regions.region_name	{}
PROPERTY	dns.spoof_regions.spoof_aws_default_regions	true
PROPERTY	dns.spoof_regions.spoof_aws_regions	false
PROPERTY	loadbalancing.loadbalancer_dns_subdomain	lb
PROPERTY	system.dns.dnsdomain	euca-hasp.eucalyptus-systems.com
PROPERTY	system.dns.nameserver	nshost.localhost
PROPERTY	system.dns.nameserveraddress	8.8.8.8
PROPERTY	system.dns.registrationid	04de74e9-e70e-4a2a-84ba-302765f7d651
PROPERTY	walrus.bucketnamesrequirednscompliance	false
{code}

To confirm that _walrus.bucketnamesrequirednscompliance_ not being set to _true_ wasn't an issue, set the cloud property to _true_.  I tried again, and still got the error. 
{code}
# euca-describe-properties | grep dns
PROPERTY	bootstrap.webservices.use_dns_delegation	true
PROPERTY	bootstrap.webservices.use_instance_dns	true
PROPERTY	dns.enabled	true
PROPERTY	dns.instancedata.enabled	true
PROPERTY	dns.ns.enabled	true
PROPERTY	dns.recursive.enabled	true
PROPERTY	dns.services.enabled	true
PROPERTY	dns.split_horizon.enabled	true
PROPERTY	dns.spoof_regions.enabled	true
PROPERTY	dns.spoof_regions.region_name	{}
PROPERTY	dns.spoof_regions.spoof_aws_default_regions	true
PROPERTY	dns.spoof_regions.spoof_aws_regions	false
PROPERTY	loadbalancing.loadbalancer_dns_subdomain	lb
PROPERTY	system.dns.dnsdomain	euca-hasp.eucalyptus-systems.com
PROPERTY	system.dns.nameserver	nshost.localhost
PROPERTY	system.dns.nameserveraddress	8.8.8.8
PROPERTY	system.dns.registrationid	04de74e9-e70e-4a2a-84ba-302765f7d651
PROPERTY	walrus.bucketnamesrequirednscompliance	true
{code}

Running _ec2-upload-bundle_ from within instance:
{code}
$ ec2-upload-bundle -b bundle-vol-docker-v2 -m /mnt/image/raring-docker.manifest.xml -a AKIYO5GIWPS4VIRN7ZU2 -s NAjydxBQuiN5sHUZpzKFHImv1W3k2O32BiZ14bXJ --url http://walrus.euca-hasp.eucalyptus-systems.com:8773/services/Walrus/
ERROR: Error talking to S3: Curl.Error(6): Couldn't resolve host 'bundle-vol-docker-v2.walrus.euca-hasp.eucalyptus-systems.com'.
{code}

Errors in eucalyptus logs:
{code}
$ sudo grep bundle-vol-docker-v2 /var/log/eucalyptus/*
/var/log/eucalyptus/cloud-debug.log:Sun Nov 17 20:42:49 2013 DEBUG [DnsResolvers:Thread-43] [com.eucalyptus.util.dns.DnsResolvers.findRecords(DnsResolvers.java):510] DnsResolvers.findRecords(): resolvers for bundle-vol-docker-v2.walrus.euca-hasp.eucalyptus-systems.com. are: []
/var/log/eucalyptus/cloud-debug.log:Sun Nov 17 20:42:49 2013 ERROR [ServiceZone:Thread-43] [com.eucalyptus.dns.ServiceZone.findRecords(ServiceZone.java):156] com.eucalyptus.util.EucalyptusCloudException: Get unique failed for BucketInfo using example: [BucketInfo ownerId=null userId=null bucketName=bundle-vol-docker-v2 creationDate=null globalRead=null globalWrite=null globalReadACP=null globalWriteACP=null bucketSize=null location=null hidden=null loggingEnabled=null targetBucket=null targetPrefix=null versioning=null grants=[] id=null version=null creationTimestamp=null lastUpdateTimestamp=null naturalId=null]
